page.title: 11CHURCH HISTORY
page.content: The high kirk of stranraer was built in 1842.The chief benefactors for the building of the church were Major General Mc Dowall and Miss Mc Dowall who lived opposite in the park house.A plaque to there memory still stands in the vestibule of the church.the church was built for Â£1790,but no doubt that was a lot of money 143 years ago when you compare that now the repairs to the church and the tower will amount to close one Â£50,000.The church owes its name to its position on the hill, and for many years ships entering Stranraer harbour have steered for the tower.For that reason engineers responsible for the dredging of Lochryan,prior to the introduction of a larger ferry,guided the dredgers by a laser beam operated from the High Kirk tower.
